ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Does anyone solo anymore?
ygData.msgSnippet: Soloing dang i have been soloing since i started playing and getting into a group seems strange at times for me id rather be in a group at times makes game
ygData.messageBody:
Soloing dang i have been soloing since i started playing and getting into a group seems strange at times for me id rather be in a group at times makes game more fun i just wish groups would be more but seems to me groups are slim to none.
-------------- Original message ----------------------
From: "Wulfric Rennison" <wulftech@...>
> Not me. I prefer grouping. It's faster xp than soloing in my opinion. As a 65
> druid, I can solo a lot of things, but it takes too much time to kill them.
> Root, snare, dot, dot, dot. Sit and wait. Keep that up til the mob is dead.
> In a group, most times I only have to worry about snaring and dotting, and maybe
> back up healing. It's not as labor intensive, and the xp moves faster with
> constant pulls. Unfortunately, lately, it seems like it's been increasingly
> more difficult to find good groups so I end up soloing most of the time anyway
> with LFG on.
>
> W
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Just Me
> To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: Sunday, April 16, 2006 1:04 PM
> Subject: [EverQuest] Does anyone solo anymore?
>
>
> After a year and a half of playing, I've done a lot of group play and
> a lot of duoing, but I seem to enjoy soloing more nowdays. I can go
> where I want, do what I want and keep the loot and xp for myself.
> Don't get me wrong, I still like to group, but sometimes, for my own
> peace of mind, I much prefer soloing. Anyone else?
>
>
>
>
>
> Visit the EverQuest homepage at http://www.everquest.com
